dismissalText.commentary: Ishan Kishan c Athanaze b Shepherd 55 (55b 6x4 1x6 79m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Brilliant catch by Athanaze at backward point. Salmon leap to the right and grabbed it - took it with both hands and lodged the ball in his right hand while keeping it above the ground - to send Kishan back for 55. Ball was on a length outside off. Kishan went for the cut. He placed it well on the first ball, this time he couldn't get it out of Athanaze's reach

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill c Joseph b Motie 34 (49b 5x4 0x6 72m) SR: 69.38

dismissalComment.html: Launched high, does it clear long-off? No! Motie tossed it up invitingly, on a length on off, ball was curving away subtly. Gill was charging down the pitch and tried to mow it over long-off. The bat turned outwards and the ball was skewed high, Joseph settled underneath to complete a good catch.

dismissalComment.html: SKY gives Athanaze another catch at backward point. This was a half-tracker, but it did grip and turn. SKY immediately went for the cut but it's just to Athanaze's left and he pouches it without any trouble. West Indies in a commanding position here

Leading edge pops to Hetmyer at cover, India all out for 181. Length ball on leg, Mukesh tried to turn it towards midwicket. May have straightened a bit as the bat face closed. Hetmyer ran across to complete a dolly.

dismissalText.commentary: Hardik Pandya c King b Seales 7 (14b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Pulled straight to King at midwicket! Bouncer around shoulder-height was angling in, Hardik was able to pull it in front of square but got it straight to the fielder. Seales yells in delight before getting into more subdued celebrations. Hardik absolutely clubbed it but got the placement wrong.

dismissalText.commentary: Sanju Samson c King b Cariah 9 (19b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 47.36

dismissalComment.html: Sharp spin induces the edge, taken at slip! Legbreak landed on a length in line with middle, spun away to around fifth stump. Samson was on the back foot, got squared up. It was like Samson was shaping to hit it square, he tried to get the bat down but the spin and bounce took the edge and the ball was pocketed safely by King

dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur lbw b Joseph 16 (22b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: LBW given, Shardul reviews quickly. Shardul was hopping to try and block the back-of-length scramble-seam ball in front. He got beaten on the inside edge as the ball came in and hit the pad, just above the knee roll. Hawk-Eye shows impact is umpire's call and projects that it would be hitting the top of off. Shardul has to go.

dismissalText.commentary: Umran Malik c Carty b Joseph 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Carty slides across from deep square leg to take a spectacular catch. First ball after the break, Umran makes room and tries to pull the short ball. He had to fetch it out a little bit and the ball went up off the toe. Carty ran to his diagonal left and put in the slide, he ensured that the ball hung in one hand and didn't pop out.

commentPreTextItems.html: Four needed to win, six needed for Carty's fifty

commentTextItems.html: Slapped over extra, one bounce four. West Indies level the series. Shortish ball over the stumps, Carty made room and duly carted it with the flat bat. He was willing it on, hoping it'd go for six, but it landed just in. He looks up with a smile and there's dancing in the crowd

commentPostTextItems.html: A decider we wants and a decider we gets thanks to West Indies' resilience on display today. You can comb through what happened in Himanshu Agrawal's match report up here. So, let's continue to hope and pun along for the showdown in Trinidad in a couple of days. Sudarshanan will join Abhimanyu, who'll return on comms. I'm Ekanth, signing on behalf of Abhimanyu Bose, and our scorers, Chandan Duorah and Ranjith P.

Shai Hope, POTM and WI captain: I'm happy as long as my contributions lead to the win. When things are difficult, you gotta find ways to score quickly. So you gotta run hard, we got twos which helped. Very satisfied, the aim was to get back to the series. We gotta win one more and need to come back strongly. We gotta put in the effort and today we displayed the right attitude, need to replicate that in all disciplines. It was a complete performance. We want to tick the boxes and get the right result in the final game.

Hardik Pandya, India captain: We didn't bat the way we were supposed to. The wicket was better than it was in the first game. Everyone barring Shubman hit fielders and got out. Disappointing but many things to learn. The way our openers batted, especially Ishan, struck it well and is good for India. Shardul got us back in with his bowling. Hope and Carty batted well and got them through. Body's fine. I have to bowl more overs and get my workload up for the World Cup. I'm a turtle right now not the rabbit and hoping everything goes right as the World Cup comes on. To be honest, you want to be going 1-1 to the third game as it'll be more challenging and exciting.
JD: "two contrasting last 91 runs for each team"

5:01pm: A brilliant steady-the-ship effort from Hope and Carty not only rescued West Indies from 91 for 4 but took them to a win without further harm. It was set up by the spinners, Joseph and Seales earlier. Mayers was at his exuberant best early on in the chase. That was before Thakur lorded into the scene. He got the bouncer right to Mayers, capitalised on King being stuck on the back foot and had him lbw, and then did Athanaze in with another bouncer. When Hetmyer, who was all at sea against spin, was dismissed by Kuldeep, India seemed to have gotten back into ascendancy. But Carty and Hope toughed it out against the pacy spin of Jadeja and Axar and the loopier variety from Kuldeep. They ran diligently and rotated strike to whittle the target. Hope got past fifty with the end in sight. The duo got through Thakur and Hardik's last crack and Carty narrowly missed out on fifty but saw West Indies through to their first win against India in over three years.

commentTextItems.html: Carty stays leg side and prods at the length ball on off. It goes off the thickish outside edge to find the deep-third boundary

Kuldeep spills it after misjudging how quickly it was coming at him. Carty mistimed the pull and the ball sailed towards him, he thought it came at him but died down on him. In the end he couldn't reach it
Guides the length ball outside off to deep third

Ball pops up in the air but Shardul can't get there! Swiveled to put this length ball away but couldn't get proper connection. Lands just in front of Shardul running in front to his left. That one hit him on the shoulder

commentPostTextItems.html: Like Hope and Carty (most probably) for West Indies, here comes Ekanth to finish the game off from our side!

Salmon leap to the right and grabbed it - took it with both hands and lodged the ball in his right hand while keeping it above the ground - to send Kishan back for 55. Ball was on a length outside off. Kishan went for the cut. He placed it well on the first ball, this time he couldn't get it out of Athanaze's reach

dismissalComment.html: Launched high, does it clear long-off? No! Motie tossed it up invitingly, on a length on off, ball was curving away subtly. dismissalComment.html: Axar can't get out of harm's way and is caught behind. Shepherd yanked the cross-seam short ball angling in towards the body, Axar tried to sway inwards but couldn't adjust with the extra pace and bounce. Thus, he was unable to drop his hands in time, and the ball took the glove en route to the keeper. Shepherd has two

dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur lbw b Joseph 16 (22b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: LBW given, Shardul reviews quickly. Shardul was hopping to try and block the back-of-length scramble-seam ball in front. He got beaten on the inside edge as the ball came in and hit the pad, just above the knee roll. Hawk-Eye shows impact is umpire's call and projects that it would be hitting the top of off. Shardul has to go.

dismissalComment.html: Carty slides across from deep square leg to take a spectacular catch. First ball after the break, Umran makes room and tries to pull the short ball. dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja c Cariah b Shepherd 10 (21b 0x4 0x6 31m) SR: 47.61

dismissalComment.html: Skies a pull and it's caught at deep backward square! Shepherd gets another wicket with a short ball!. Jadeja did not get a hold of this at all and gets a top edge that goes high in the air. Cariah has to move to his right but he settles under the ball and takes it comfortably in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur lbw b Joseph 16 (22b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: LBW given, Shardul reviews quickly. Shardul was hopping to try and block the back-of-length scramble-seam ball in front. He got beaten on the inside edge as the ball came in and hit the pad, just above the knee roll. Hawk-Eye shows impact is umpire's call and projects that it would be hitting the top of off. Shardul has to go.

dismissalText.commentary: Umran Malik c Carty b Joseph 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Carty slides across from deep square leg to take a spectacular catch. First ball after the break, Umran makes room and tries to pull the short ball. He had to fetch it out a little bit and the ball went up off the toe. Carty ran to his diagonal left and put in the slide, he ensured that the ball hung in one hand and didn't pop out.

dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer b Kuldeep Yadav 9 (15b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Through him, skids through to off stump. Looked like a googly, the length ball came back after pitching just outside off. Hetmyer's front leg cleared, presumably to steer the ball square on the off side, but the ball spinning in cramped him for room. He underedged it while closing the bat on the last second and it clattered onto off.
